intro: Dombeya louvelii, commonly known as the African dombeya, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Dombeya louvelii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
